titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Bookplate Collection, approximately 1890-1955
titlestmt.author: Inventory prepared by the Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries.

publicationstmt.publisher: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Jason Kovari, 3 Feb 2009

did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Bookplate Collection

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

did.abstract: The Vassar College Bookplate Collection consists of over 5000 items, most of which are mounted and indexed by type and name of owner and by designer, if prominent.

bioghist.head: Administrative History
bioghist.p: The Vassar College Bookplate Collection consists of several parts, the largest of which was gathered by Adelaide Underhill, VC 1888 and former Librarian at Vassar (1892-1928). In 1896 she commissioned from Edwin Davis French a bookplate for the Vassar Alumnae Historical Association. Using this bookplate for exchange, she built an impressive collection, which included examples of the work of the most important bookplate designers of the period and also early armorial bookplates. After her retirement, the collection came to Vassar permanently and continued to grow. It consists of over 5000 items, most of which are mounted and indexed by type and name of owner and by designer (if prominent).
Another part of the Collections is a collection of bookplates which the Vassar College Library has used over the years, primarily during the first half of the 20th century.
In 1949, Professor Charles Gordon Post gave a small collection of bookplates related primarily to the medical sciences.

The most recent addition to the Collection was the gift, in 1972, of the sizable collection of Margaret A. Pollard Smith, VC 1902 and also a former faculty member. Her collection was also strong in representing the important bookplate designers of the late 19th century and the first half of the 20th century.

chronitem.event: Vassar College Bookplate Collection begun by Adelaide Underhill, VC 1888
Edwin Davis French designs bookplate for the Vassar Alumnae Historical Association
Professor Charles Gordon Post donates collection of bookplates related to the medical sciences
Margaret A. Pollard Smith's collection of important late-19th and early-20th century bookplate designers donated

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Vassar College Bookplate Collection consists of over 5000 items, most of which are mounted and indexed by type and name of owner and by designer, if prominent.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research according to the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library without any additional restrictions.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to quote (publish) from unpublished or previously published material must be obtained as described in the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library.

odd.head: Encoding Information
odd.p: Finding aid encoded by Jason Kovari, 5 Feb 2009.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Finding aid processed by Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Bookplate Collection acquired through gifts of Adelaide Underhill, Charles Gordon Post and Harry J. Smith; collection acquired by exchange, as well.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Bookplate Collection, Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged in six series, and by type and alphabetically within each of those series.

did.unittitle: Series I. Adelaide Underhill Bookplate Collection
Series II.Margaret A. Pollard Smith Bookplate Collection
Series III. Charles Gordon Post Bookplate Collection
Series IV. Framed Materials
Series V. Vassar College Library Bookplates

scopecontent.p: Box 26: Vassar College Library Bookplates and Supporting Material

Includes bookplates designed by Alfred J. Downey, Sara B. Hill, and Stanley Harrod; also armorial bookplates designed by various artists of the 18th and 19th centuries.
Includes bookplates designed by Timothy Cole, Sidney L. Smith, and W.F. Hopson; also early armorial bookplates and some miscellaneous pictorial plates.
Includes bookplates designed by O. U., Gayfield Shaw, and F. Bayros; also miscellaneous etched and process plates.
Includes bookplates designed by C.W. Sherborn, and W.P. Barrett; also a few miscellaneous plates.
SERIES III. Charles Gordon Post Bookplate Collection

Scrapbook of bookplates, compiled by Charles Gordon Post (Professor of Political Science, 1933-1969), 1927-1946. The bookplates include those of libraries/doctors connected with Johns Hopkins University, Tulane Medical School, Vassar College, the University of Rochester, New York Public Library, Metropolitan Museum of Art, Columbia University, and the University of Virginia.
